author: Umed--[SKY] SkyLight Pool
title: PoolTool-Testnet Support
description: Samuel at IOHK has requested that we have a version of PoolTool for the Testnet as well as mainnet.

assessments.note: Having a tool like PoolTool.io will be interesting for testnet. Good proposal.
Yes, this proposal is more oriented to developers, which helps to attract developers coming to cardano

PoolTool has been an important tool for the Cardano community, including developers. The inclusion of a version of PoolTool for TestNet addresses the challenge as it will be a useful tool for different metrics / APIs.

It's hard not to award top marks for a proposal that was A) requested by an IOG team member and B) proposed by the existing PoolTool Mainnet provider. Given I use pooltool.io regularly, I am confident the team know what they are doing and that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
It would be highly important to have tools which are used on main net to be available on test net as well.
very strong team behind this proposal and a must have

I like the general idea - but I don't understand why problem statement reads as following "Samuel from IOHK has requested..." That doesn't seem to be fitting the form? I would have liked to learn more about benefits of supporting pooltool for testnet to the greater community. I can assume what these can be but some effort within the proposal itself would have been nice. E.g. we see great need to support tools for SPOs who run testnet operation when testing elements for main net. By enabling these tools - we are able to help test features on Cardano and make them that much better" or something like that - not that Samuel has asked and that's why we are here...makes sense, right? Bottom line - it would have been greater if authors started with explaining why testnet is important and pool tools participation vital in it. That would have set the tone a bit better.
The pooltool team has already proven their experience with pooltool.io on mainnet. I don't see  how deploying the same tool for the testnet would fail.
Since pooltool team already has good experience building explorer, testnet version of it won't be much effort for them

The proposal doesn't involve relevant complexity, only the need to fund servers for the expansion of the services provided by Pooltool. The proposal was created by the Pooltool team itself, which is extremely capable.
As above, it's hard to argue that this proposal won't be implemented successfully.
pooltool was one of the first product on the cardano ecosystem so there is no doubt that proposal will be implemented.

Would have preferred more effort put into the proposal outlining in greater detail the needs. This feels a bit more like throwing a dart at the target seeing where it lands? I really don't get why it all rests on Samuel who has no part in pooltool on whether this thing runs or not. That is awkward  presentation. It seems not respectful of the process much. On the other hand, I have no doubt that pooltool team is very competent to run this - very smart group - but this proposal just reads incomplete in light of expectations. So I am willing to offer benefit of doubt. The thing is - this might just get funded given how low of amount it is being requested anyway? So let's see - good luck and keep up the work.
I don't know the resources needed for a tool like pooltool.io, 500/per month seems a bit expensive just for server expenses, but time for deployment and maintenance totally justify the cost.
The cost breakdownm technincal details is straighforward

The proposal addresses the challenge, Pooltool provides an essential service for the Cardano community and developers. The proposal is simple, short and objective, due to the simplicity of the proposal there is no need for a complex / detailed plan. The budget is clear and is intended to cover server costs.
The reasons are simple and clear. Extensive experience dictates that this team know the exact costs and requirements to successfully implement this project.
As usual pooltool team has provided sufficient information to asses the feasibility of the project not just that amount asked is also well  thought.

This is very limited proposal in its scope - so perhaps it is not necessary to have specific roadmap and milestones in great detail - but I would have loved to learn why this effort will be useful. How are authors thinking about success metrics. Would it be by number of visits? If so how much. Or would it be how happy Samuel is on scale 1-10? :))) Jokes aside - what are the wider implication of this proposal that we can measure long term? Are there any challenges/risks associated with it? None of these have been given any consideration in this proposal. Perhaps it is by design, but given on criteria we try to hold each proposal accountable to - it seems deficient. Few more bullets points, sentences would have done the trick, I believe.

solution: We have spun up the testnet on the main pooltool platform with limited features and would like to have the fund cover our base expenses.
experience: We are the team behind pooltool.io
